page.title: 12The Local Pub.
page.content:
The{Elephant and Castle}opened as a hostelry in 1860 when travellers stayed the night while their horses were fed and rested before they could continue their journey down the rough roads.The stables have been demolished but you can still see the trough and an old pump for home-made beer. { Mr.Ernest Nickless}worked there for twenty three years.
The pub used to have two bars and a cosy alcove and beer was drawn straight from the barrel. Two and a half years ago the pub changed to become the{"Pink Elephant". The smaller rooms were knocked into one big one,meals and wine are now served and younger people come from neighbouring towns to enjoy the music and barbecues.
